lead_paragraph: The American George Hincapie won the second stage of the Dauphiné Libéré race in a sprint finish in Vienne, France. He finished the 114.3-mile stage in 4 hours 32 minutes 38 seconds. Sébastien Chavanel was second and Sébastian Lang was third. Thor Hushovd was fifth and retained the overall lead. The third stage of the Dauphiné Libéré, a warm-up for the Tour de France, will be a 19.3-mile time trial on Wednesday.
